responses: For B.Tech, there are 8 semesters, and for MBA, there are 4 semesters. Each semester covers specific subjects and includes both theory and practical components.
The MBA program consists of 4 semesters, while the B.Tech program has 8 semesters, allowing students to explore various subjects relevant to their field.

patterns: how many internal exams are there
responses: There are four internal exams named Continuous Assessment (CA) for theory papers and two Practical Continuous Assessments (PCA) for practicals. Additionally, there is one semester exam that includes both theory and practical components.
CA1 is a technical PPT submission containing 25 marks.
CA2 is a technical report writing assignment containing 25 marks.
CA3 is a written-based exam containing 25 marks.
CA4 is a computer-based MCQ exam containing 25 marks, conducted by MAKAUT.
PCA1 is a practical internal exam containing 40 marks.
PCA2 is another practical internal exam containing 40 marks.

responses: The semester exam for theory papers contains 70 marks for each subject and lasts for 3 hours.

responses: The semester exam for practical papers contains 60 marks for each practical paper, which includes 20 marks for the lab copy, 20 marks for the viva, and 20 marks for the written exam.
